author: @gurufocus
title: Sunrun Inc (RUN) Reports Strong Q4 2024 Financial Results with Positive Cash Generation
text:
Sunrun Inc (RUN, Financial), a leading provider of clean energy as a subscription service, announced its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year ending December 31, 2024. The company reported a cash generation of $34 million in Q4, marking the third consecutive quarter of positive cash generation. Sunrun also paid down $132 million of recourse debt in Q4 and increased its net earning assets to $6.8 billion. The company exceeded its guidance range for storage capacity installed, achieving 392 megawatt hours, representing a 78% year-over-year growth. Sunrun has set a cash generation guidance of $200 million to $500 million for 2025. The press release was issued on February 27, 2025.
Positive Highlights
- Third consecutive quarter of positive cash generation with $34 million in Q4.
- Paid down $132 million of recourse debt in Q4.
- Storage capacity installed exceeded guidance with 392 megawatt hours, a 78% year-over-year growth.
- Net earning assets increased to $6.8 billion.
- Set ambitious cash generation guidance of $200 million to $500 million for 2025.
Negative Highlights
- Reported a net loss attributable to common stockholders of $2,813.7 million for Q4 2024.
- Revenue from solar energy systems and product sales decreased by 33% compared to Q4 2023.
- Recorded a non-cash goodwill impairment charge of approximately $3.1 billion.
Financial Analyst Perspective
From a financial analyst's perspective, Sunrun Inc's performance in Q4 2024 demonstrates a strong focus on improving cash flow and reducing debt. The company's ability to generate positive cash flow for three consecutive quarters is a significant achievement, especially in the renewable energy sector. However, the substantial net loss and goodwill impairment highlight challenges in managing costs and market conditions. The ambitious cash generation targets for 2025 indicate confidence in future growth and operational efficiency improvements.
Market Research Analyst Perspective
As a market research analyst, Sunrun Inc's results reflect a growing demand for renewable energy solutions, particularly in storage capacity. The company's strategic focus on optimizing product mix and targeting high-value geographies is likely to enhance its market position. The increase in storage attachment rates to 62% suggests a strong consumer interest in integrated solar and storage solutions. However, the decline in solar energy systems sales revenue indicates potential market saturation or increased competition.
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
Q: What was Sunrun's cash generation in Q4 2024?
A: Sunrun generated $34 million in cash in Q4 2024.
Q: How much recourse debt did Sunrun pay down in Q4?
A: Sunrun paid down $132 million of recourse debt in Q4 2024.
Q: What is Sunrun's cash generation guidance for 2025?
A: Sunrun's cash generation guidance for 2025 is between $200 million and $500 million.
Q: How much did Sunrun's storage capacity grow year-over-year in Q4 2024?
A: Sunrun's storage capacity grew by 78% year-over-year in Q4 2024.
Q: What was the net loss attributable to common stockholders in Q4 2024?
A: The net loss attributable to common stockholders was $2,813.7 million in Q4 2024.

author: Angela Espinoza Hermoza
title: Por qué seguir una dieta de solo jugos podría ser malo para tu salud
text:
¿Crees que una dieta a base de jugos te hace más saludable? En la Universidad Northwestern se ha realizado un estudio que sugiere que este tipo de dieta podría tener el efecto contrario. La investigación, publicada en Nutrients, señala que una dieta que se basa únicamente en jugos de frutas y verduras, incluso cuando solo es por tres días, puede provocar cambios en las bacterias intestinales y bucales, que se relacionan con la inflamación y el deterioro cognitivo.
Para esta investigación, los científicos estudiaron tres grupos de adultos sanos: el primero consumió únicamente jugos, el segundo consumió jugos con comidas y el tercero consumió solo alimentos de origen vegetal. Los científicos recolectaron saliva, hisopados bucales y muestras de heces antes, durante y después de las dietas con el objetivo de analizar los cambios bacterianos utilizando técnicas de secuenciación genética.
En la investigación los resultados determinaron que el grupo que solo consumió jugos mostró el mayor aumento de bacterias asociadas con inflamación y permeabilidad intestinal, mientras que el grupo que consumió alimentos basados en plantas tuvo cambios microbianos más favorables. Aquellos que consumieron jugos pero también alimentos, vieron cambios en las bacterias pero no tan severos como aquellos que solo consumieron jugos.
Estos hallazgos sugieren que el consumo de jugos a corto plazo puede afectar negativamente a la microbiota, concluye la investigación.
La autora principal, la doctora Melinda Ring, directora del Centro Osher para la Salud Integral de la Facultad de Medicina Feinberg de la Universidad Northwestern y médica de la Universidad Northwestern, explicó que “la mayoría de las personas piensan que tomar jugos es una forma saludable de depurar, pero este estudio nos pone al día con la realidad”.
“Consumir grandes cantidades de jugo con poca fibra puede provocar desequilibrios en el microbioma que podrían tener consecuencias negativas, como inflamación y menor salud intestinal”, recalcó.

author: T0@st
title: Intel Reportedly Close to Receiving $3.5 Billion Investment for US Military Chip Solutions | TechPowerUp Forums
text:
The US government is reported to be preparing a very healthy $3.5 billion investment in Intel Corporation—a mid-week published Bloomberg article proposes that the White House has authored a new "fast-moving spending bill." Congressional aides believe that Team Blue—upon official approval/signing off of funds—will be tasked with the production of advanced semiconductors for military and intelligence programs. Bloomberg posits that the resources will be sourced from a " Secure Enclave " project, seemingly linking to a wider tranche of funds within the US government's CHIPS and Science Act. The agreement/contract is expected to run over a period of three years. According to Bloomberg: "the Senate is expected to pass the legislation by a Saturday (March 9) deadline."
Reports from last November suggested that Intel leadership and US government representatives had engaged in negotiations regarding funds for military and intelligence chip applications—the construction costs for new manufacturing facilities were estimated to be in the $3 billion to $4 billion range. A Commerce Department statement was submitted to Bloomberg, but they only commented on an overall $10 billion budget: "We are still reviewing the effect of the appropriations text on the program...(we look) forward to continuing to work with Congress on implementing the Chips and Science Act in a manner the promotes our economic and national security." TSMC, Micron and Samsung are expected to receive "multi-billion-dollar awards" in the near future—these multinational corporations will assist in a bolstering of North American chip manufacturing capabilities.
View at TechPowerUp Main Site | Source

author: Yuri Zoria
title: Ukraine’s national guardsmen down Russian cruise missile with machine guns
text: During Russia’s [massive missile attack](https://euromaidanpress.com/2023/12/29/ukraine-under-massive-air-attack-updates/?swcfpc=1) against Ukraine on 29 December, a mobile fire group of machine gunners of the 27th Pechersk Brigade of Ukraine’s National Guard shot down a Russian cruise missile using small arms in Kyiv Oblast, the Brigade reported on “After detecting the target moving towards Kyiv, the National Guard opened fire with machine guns,” according to the report. The Brigade says that the examination of the missile’s wreckage showed that the small arms fire caused an explosion of its fuel tanks, which led to the missile losing control and altitude. The missile crashed, but its warhead did not detonate. [Ukraine under massive air attack: civilians casualties reported in Kyiv, Lviv, Dnipro, Zaporizhzhia (updates)] “The National Guard’s fire teams are designed to counter air strikes, including shooting down missiles and kamikaze drones. Combined with the efficient work of air defense units, this allows us to increase the success rate of shooting down air targets and thus save infrastructure and the lives of our citizens,” the Pechersk Brigade noticed. The National Guard does not mention the missile type. However, according to the December 29 [report](https://euromaidanpress.com/2023/12/29/military-ukraine-downs-114-of-158-missiles-and-drones-during-russias-most-massive-air-attack/?swcfpc=1) by the Air Force, Russia launched 90 air-based Kh-101/Kh-555/Kh-55 cruise missiles, of which the air defenders destroyed 87. Additionally, Russia launched Kh-22/Kh-32, Kh-47M2 Kinzhal, and ballistic missiles of several types during the attack, but Ukraine did not claim successful interceptions of any of those. [Military: Ukraine downs 114 of 158 missiles and drones during Russia’s “most massive” air attack] Read also:
